loans.name: Por Una Vida Digna Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de mujeres  que con entusiasmo y mucha dedicación sale adelante cada día. Así son las integrantes de la alcancía comunal Por un Vida Digna conformado por 6 socias, que tiene un solo objetivo, el de salir adelante sin importar los obstáculos que se les presentan a lo largo de la vida. Tal es a si el caso de la señora Ninfa de 53 años de edad casada y madre de 3 hijos. Que en busca de una mejora económica de su hogar decide abrir una bodega en su casa hace más de 9 años, esta fuente de ingresos le ha generado muchas satisfacciones como son los estudios de sus hijos y la implementación de muebles para su hogar, en conjunto con su esposo a sabido sobresalir y mejorar su estilo de vida y de su familia. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compras de mercadería. Como la señora Ninfa cada integrante de esta alcancía tiene un historia en particular pero, todas coinciden en un solo objetivo que es el de salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, para el bienestar de sus hogares.
*En la fotografía la Sra. Ninfa se encuentra con una chompa rosada y esta de pie.
texts.en: This is a group of women who, with enthusiasm and much dedication, move forward every day. These are the members of the communal bank "Por un Vida Digna" (For a Dignified Life), which consists of 6 members who have a single goal: to advance in spite of the obstacles that are presented to them in the course of life. This is the case for Señora Ninfa, who is 53 years old, is married, and is the mother of 3 children. In search of a better household economy, she decided to open a grocery store in her house more than 9 years ago. This source of income has generated much satisfaction for her, as have the education of her children and the furnishing of her home. Along with her husband, she has known how to excel and to improve her lifestyle and that of her family. With the current loan, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise. Like Señora Ninfa, each member of this communal bank has a particular story, but all have a single objective, which is to advance with effort and education for the well-being of their households.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Martha Lucía

texts.es:
Martha tiene desde hace 4 años una venta de productos de uso personal a través de catálogo, con la cual genera ingresos para contribuir económicamente en el sostenimiento del hogar donde convive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Gracias a que ofrece un muy buen servicio a sus clientes ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes, lo que le garantiza muy buenas ventas. Por esto, como se avecina la temporada del día de las madres, Martha busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos de uso personal para poder tener un buen surtido para la temporada del día de las madres.

De esta manera podrá ofrecerles a sus clientes gran variedad de productos lo que le garantizará tener muy buenas ventas. Su sueño es que su pequeña venta de productos se convierta en un gran almacén donde pueda generar empleo para las demás personas. También espera que con su negocio se siga mejorando la calidad de vida en su hogar y también tener mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Comprar productos de uso personal para poder tener un buen surtido para la temporada del día de las madres.

loans.name: Duvan Stiven

texts.es:
Duvan es un joven emprendedor de 21 años de edad quien recibió desde hace un par de años el negocio de trascendencia familiar el cual es la preparación y venta de arepas, y gracias al esfuerzo que hace diariamente en su negocio ha logrado sacarlo adelante y aumentar sus ventas considerablemente. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado tener muy buenas ventas, lo que le ha permitido tener unos ingresos con los cuales toda su familia tiene una mejor calidad de vida. Sin embargo, también presenta algunas dificultades como son la falta de capital y un daño que tienen en el techo que les crea inconvenientes cuando el clima es muy lluvioso. Con el ánimo de responder a algunos pedidos, Duvan busca un préstamo para comprar bultos de maíz y también reparar el daño en el techo de su negocio.

De esta manera podrá responder a los pedidos de sus clientes y seguir aumentando sus ventas, además de que solucionará el inconveniente en su techo y así podrá tener una mejor producción. Otra dificultad que tienen es que sus productos los venden sin etiqueta, por eso el sueño de Duvan es poder tener una etiqueta para sus arepas y así crecer el reconocimiento por sus productos.

loans.use: Comprar bultos de maíz y también reparar el daño en el techo de su negocio.

loans.name: Virgencita De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
La señora BENJAMINA es socia de la alcancía comunal VIRGENCITA DE GUADALUPE del distrito de El Tambo, ella es madre soltera, y tuvo que trabajar muy duro logrando así sacar adelante  a sus hijos, todos ya con mayoría de edad.
Benjamina se dedica a la venta de ropa, siempre la ha caracterizado sus ganas de surgir y tiene un gran objetivo que es la de contar con un local cómodo y amplio para expender su mercadería, por eso es que solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de más ropa y así surtir su negocio. Benjamina es la sexta persona de la izquierda, viste chompa verde clara y pantalón azul.
texts.en:
Benjamina is a member of the “Virgencita de Guadalupe” communal bank in El Tambo District.  She’s a single mother and had to work very hard to move her children ahead; they are all now adults.

Benjamina works selling used clothes.  She’s always been noted for her drive to surge forward and she has a great objective which is to have a comfortable, spacious locale in which to sell her merchandise which is why she’s asking for the loan to be able to invest in her prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es:
Norberto tiene hace aproximadamente unos 8 años un taller de reparación de bicicletas y motocicletas con el cual genera los ingresos para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. La actividad la aprendió gracias a su hermano mayor y desde entonces ha venido trabajando fuertemente para crecer con su taller y aumentar sus clientes. Norberto busca un préstamo para comprar repuestos como son llantas, tuercas, neumáticos, pinturas, entre otros y así poder responder a la demanda de sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio podrá salir adelante y sus ingresos aumentarán considerablemente, ya que en la actualidad sus clientes le hacen numerosos pedidos que no puede cubrir por la falta de repuestos. Su sueño es tener un taller grande donde pueda generar empleo y tener su propio almacén de venta de repuestos.

loans.use: Comprar repuestos como son llantas, tuercas, neumáticos, pinturas, entre otros y así poder responder a la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.name: Wilmar De Jesus

texts.es:
Wilmar se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos, y para generar los ingresos necesarios para su hogar tiene un cultivo de verduras desde hace aproximadamente 10 años. Sus productos los vende en la plaza de mercado de su municipio, y gracias a la buena calidad de estos puede venderlos a un muy buen precio. Gracias a que ahora tiene muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes, Wilmar busca un préstamo para comprar abonos y semillas y así sacar adelante su cultivo para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá superar la mayor dificultad que tiene que es la falta de capital para hacer crecer su negocio. Además, Wilmar espera recibir mejores ingresos por la venta de sus cultivos y así poder brindar en su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Comprar abonos y semillas y así sacar adelante su cultivo para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis se encuentra casado y tiene 3 hijos, y hace aproximadamente 1 año montó una venta de verduras con la cual pueda generar mayores ingresos para su hogar, ya que en el empleo que se encontraba anteriormente no podía devengar un salario que sea suficiente para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar. En su venta de verduras ofrece a sus clientes productos de muy buena calidad, y esto le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas. Es por esto que ahora busca un préstamo para comprar verduras y así surtir su negocio para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio podrá salir adelante y así poder brindar a sus clientes mejor servicio. Además, Luis espera que sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente y así pueda brindar en su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Comprar verduras y así surtir su negocio para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es:
Johana es una joven de 22 años de edad que se encuentra casada y tiene una hija de 3 meses de nacido, y hace aproximadamente 1 año viene ofreciendo el servicio a domicilio de arreglo de uñas. Gracias a este trabajo, ha venido generando ingresos con los que puede contribuir económicamente en su hogar y también sostener algunos gastos que se generan en su hogar. Ahora, Johana quiere montar un salón de belleza en su casa aprovechando la experiencia que tiene y también comenzar con la actividad del corte y cepillado del cabello, en el cual lleva algún tiempo estudiando. Debido a que no cuenta con el capital suficiente, Johana busca un préstamo para comprar un tocador, una silla, un espejo y un lavacabezas para iniciar su negocio.

De esta manera podrá iniciar su propio negocio y así generar más ingresos para su hogar. Johana ve una gran oportunidad el tener el negocio en su propia casa ya que podrá cuidar de mejor manera a su hija de 3 meses, y así brindarle una buena calidad de vida. Su sueño es tener un buen negocio con el que pueda tener una estabilidad económica en su hogar y con el cual pueda brindar una buena calidad de vida a su hija.

loans.use: Comprar un tocador, una silla, un espejo y un lavacabezas para iniciar su negocio.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: Luis tiene 55 años, está casado y vive en Guayaquil junto a su familia. Vive en el sector conocido como Isla Trinitaria donde tiene su casa donde tiene almacenado sus productos. Sus inicios como comerciante fueron hace 18 años esta actividad la escogió por no encontrar trabajo y además para el mismo ponerse su sueldo. El trabajo lo realiza solo de lunes a viernes ya que los fines de semana viaja a otros sectores o pueblos. Al momento no a tenido ningún tipo de inconvenientes en cuanto a la delincuencia pero si en temporada de invierno en la cual por el daño que sufren las carreteras se le complican los viajes. Su esposa Maria es ama de casa y 2 de sus 3 hijos son mayores de edad e independientes, uno de ellos la menor estudia la universidad. con el prestamo compra otros articulos para la venta como cuadernos, lapices, cartulinas ya que recorre el sector con venta de puerta a puerta. su meta a futuro es terminar la construccion de su casa.
texts.en:
Luis is 55 years old, married, and lives with his family in Guayaquil.  He resides in the neighborhood known as Isla Trinitaria.  There he owns a house where he stores his products.  Luis started working as a merchant 18 years ago.  He was not able to find a job, so he chose this line of work so that he could earn a living.  Luis only works in his store Monday through Friday.  On the weekends, he travels to other neighborhoods and towns.  

At the moment, he is not experiencing any problems related to crime.  However, the winter season brings about damage to the roads, thereby making his trips more complicated.  His wife Maria is a homemaker and two of his three children are grown and independent.  The younger adult child studied at the university.  With this loan, Luis will buy products such as notebooks, pencils, and card stock paper that he can sell by going door-to-door.  His future goal is to finish the construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, and card stock paper.

loans.name: Princeville's Group

texts.en:
Princeville is 20 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married with one adult child.

Princeville operates a general store in their place and she earns approximately 4000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 30,900 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Princeville has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. She hope to have a convenience store after five years.

Princeville is the leader of a three-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Leanne Grace Group

texts.en:
Leanne Grace is 37 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children. 

Leanne Grace has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to be used in purchasing a secondhand motorcab for her business. 

Leanne Grace has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Leanne Grace hopes to expand her business. 

She is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing a secondhand motorcab for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hens

loans.name: San Jose De Jutiapa Group

texts.es: ASDDFD

loans.use: COMPRA DE ABARROTERIA EN GENERAL

loans.name: Raba'ah

texts.en:
Raba'ah is 36 years old and married. She lives in Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan.

Raba'ah is requesting a loan for 300 JOD, which she will use to buy new furniture for her home and paint it to be more healthy for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy furniture and paint her home.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is a 47-year-old married woman.  She is a mother of 2 children and she lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Khalwa wants to take out a loan of 500 JOD so that she can buy inventory home furnishings. In the future she want to open a store in her home.

loans.use: to buy inventory home furnishings

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Phal is 29 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been making baskets to sell for more than seven years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband purchases cattle to resell. He earns about $4 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Phal is requesting a loan of $700 to raise capital for her husband’s business. The loan will enable her husband to earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use to expand the business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to raise capital for her husband's business to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Sav

texts.en: Sav is 61 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She farms rice and raises animals. She earns about $2 per day. Her husband is a retired teacher--his pension is about $3 per day. Three of her children are soldiers. They earn about $9 per day. Due to her family's difficulty in commuting, Sav is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey  is a 23-year-old single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as confident and ambitious. He operates a carpentry retail store where he sells furnitures such as tables, wall units, sofa sets and beds. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenges to be a shortage of raw materials and insufficient funds for maintenance. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy timber worth 30,000 KES. His business goal is to engage himself in contractual carpentry work. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a plot.

loans.use: to buy timber for his carpentry business.

loans.name: 16 De Septiembre Group

texts.es: Doña Vilma tiene 46 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario 16 de Septiembre, es madre soltera de cinco hijos. Inicio el negocio cuando sus hijos le daban mercadería para vender y después decidió sacar un crédito para establecer su negocio, ella desde hace tres se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, y también vende comida por encargo, su horario de atención es de 6:00 am a 6:00 pm, trabaja en conjunto con uno de sus hijos y es quien le ayuda a trasladar la comida a domicilio. El préstamo que doña Vilma solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería como ser: ropa y zapatos de todos los estilos, para ofrecerle a sus clientes nuevas modas y poder atraer más compradores a su negocio. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá tener mejor surtido su negocio y así darles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de ropa y zapatos. Sus sueños es ampliar su negocio y mantenerlo bien surtido para que sus clientes encuentren siempre lo que necesiten. Doña Vilma tiene dos ciclos de trabajar con FAMA y han cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.

loans.use: COMPRA DE ABARROTERIA EN GENERAL

loans.name: Evelyn Patricia

texts.es: Evelyn mantiene en Isla Trinitaria una venta de ropa. Tiene 31 años de edad y está casada. El negocio lo inicio gracias a una amiga que la convenció de ir a vacacionar a Panamá. En esta ciudad se dio cuenta que la ropa es bonita y económica por lo que la animo a que traiga ropa y empiece el negocio. Su horario de trabajo empieza desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche pero lo realiza solo bajo pedido. No comento que de esta manera le resulta con más beneficios ya que tiene su clientela seleccionada evitando de esa manera que no le queden mal en los pagos. Su esposo Jacinto le ayuda con la venta y también en la compra de la mercadería, cuando no puede viajar ella lo realiza su esposo. Tienen 2 hijos de 15 y 13 años de edad y estudian en un colegio particular cerca de su domicilio. Con el préstamo va a viajar a Panamá para invertir comprando ropa como blusas, camisas, pantalones etc. su sueño próximo es terminar de construir su domicilio y que sus hijos terminen su estudios hasta poderlos apoyar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Evelyn manages a clothing business in Isla Trinitaria. She is 31 years old and married. Evelyn started this business thanks to a friend who convinced her to go on a vacation in Panama. While she was there, she found beautiful and affordable clothing that she was eager to bring back with her in order to start a business. Her work schedule begins at 9am and continues until 8pm, but only if she has to complete an order. She says that it has been very beneficial for her to avoid certain customers who are delinquent with their payments. Her husband helps with making sales and also buying the merchandise whenever she is not able to travel. They have two children, ages 15 and 13, who are studying at a private high school near their home.

With this loan, Evelyn will travel to Panama so that she can buy clothing such as blouses, shirts, trousers, and other items. Her next wishes are to finish the construction of her home and to see her children finish their studies through the university level.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, trousers, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: María Concepción tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijas y un hijo, reside en la Aldea San Nicolás. Doña María inició vendiendo nacatamales y ropa de segunda mano, y desde hace algunos años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de rosquillas y quesadillas, ella también tiene venta de abarrotería en general. Ella se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para iniciar su jornada laboral, desde las 6:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm, dos de sus hijas le ayudan atender la pulpería mientras ella se dedica a la elaboración del horneado de rosquillas y quesadillas. Por la venta de su producto obtiene una buena ganancia pero cuando llueve mucho le va mal porque la leña se moja y no le da buen punto al pan y este se pasa de tiempo, en la pulpería le va muy bien ya que no tiene mucha competencia y le deja buenas ganancias. El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de productos como ser: arroz, azúcar, huevos, productos lácteos, manteca, plátanos, frijoles, leña, etc. Y con lo que venda ella podrá seguir sosteniendo a su familia y también podrá ahorrar un poco para responder ante cualquier emergencia. Su sueño es apoyar a sus hijas para que cada una de ellas tenga su propio negocio y puedan ganarse la vida honradamente. María Concepción ha sido cliente de FAMA por mas de nueve ciclos y ha sido una cliente que ha pagado sus cuotas puntualmente.

loans.use: COMPRA DE ABARROTERIA EN GENERAL

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá, tiene una despensa bien surtida desde hace mas de 7 años. Nos comenta que su negocio está en su propia casa, desde donde surte a sus vecinos y a ocasionales clientes todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad.
La señora Eugenia solicita el préstamo para aumentar su stock de productos, como ser azúcar, carnes, lácteos, panificados y otros productos debido a la gran demanda que tiene, esto la ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Ella agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Sra. Eugenia is 52 years old and lives in the city of Itá. She has a well-stocked food pantry that she has managed for more than seven years. Eugenia says that her business is located in her home, which is where her neighbors and occasional customers can find all types of basic necessities.

She is requesting a loan in order to increase her stock of products such as sugar, meats, dairy products, baked goods, and other items that are in great demand. This will help improve her family's income and their quality of life. Eugenia is grateful for the opportunity she has received from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy sugar, meats, dairy products, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is married with 3 children. He is 31 years old and lives in Pangabuan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

Jeffrey sells groceries goods and aggrivet supplies for hugs to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, he earns PHP 30,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase groceries goods and agrivet supplies for hugs.

Jeffrey became a member of PMPC this year.  In the future, he hopes to use the profits to improve living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase groceries goods and aggrivet supplies for hugs

loans.name: Sareim

texts.en:
Sareim is 27 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs the business of purchasing junk materials to resell. He earns about $10 per day.

Sareim is building her house. Due to lack of funds, Sareim is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase cement to use for building her house. This money will help her finish the house’s construction and provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cement to use for building her house

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn is 40 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling fish for over ten years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Her children are still in her care and in school. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sokhorn is requesting a loan of $800 to raise capital in her business for purchasing more fish for resale. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a small truck for carrying fish to sell and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business for purchasing more fish for resale.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal is 40 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling dessert for more than three years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about $10 per day. One of her children is employed and earns about $4 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sophal is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Nougnito Rènee

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans, Nougnito Rènee est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 15 mois. Elle a un niveau d'instruction primaire et vend des produits de mercerie dans sa boutique depuis huit ans. Nougnito Rènee s'approvisionne dans les marchés de la place. Sa clientèle est constituée des femmes, des  hommes et surtout des artisans. Dans le but de satisfaire ses clients, elle fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Nougnito Rènee is 36 years old and married. She has three children ranging in age from 12 years to 15 months, and two of her children are in school. She herself went to elementary school. 

For eight years, she has been selling dry goods in her boutique. Nougnito Rènee buys her supplies at the marketplace. Her clients are women, men, and above all - artisans. 

With the goal of satisfying her clients' needs, she depends on financing from Finadev to reinforce her business and maximize her profit.

loans.use: buy 2 boxes of wire, 1 box of zippers, 5 rolls of fabric, 1 box of wool, and 3 boxes of needles.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto transporta frutas por mayor. La base y éxito de su negocio esta en el volumen de fruta que transporte diariamente para su distribución. Sus clientes son fijos pero en el caso de que no le compren el producto realiza la venta por menor ya que las frutas no son de larga duración y se dañan ocasionándole pérdida. El negocio lo empezó hace 9 años por iniciativa propia ya que viviendo en Milagros la variedad de productos es extensa. Para ayudarse en la economía realiza trabajos de aluminio a personas conocidas. El transporte de frutas lo realiza todos los días de lunes a domingo con un ayudante. Al momento no presenta ninguna dificultas y espera continuar de esa manera. En la actualidad Carlos Alberto a sus 35 años está separado y sus hijos viven con la mamá a quien le ayuda de manera económica. Con el crédito compra frutas por ciento para su distribución. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio donde pueda brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto transports wholesale fruit. The foundation and success of his business lie in the volume of fruit that he transports daily for distribution. His customer base is fixed, but in cases where they don't buy his product he makes retail sales because the fruit doesn't last very long and it gets damaged, causing him losses.

He started his business 9 years ago of his own accord, since, living in Milagros, the variety of products is extensive. To help himself in this economy he also does aluminum works for people he knows. He transports fruit every day from Monday to Sunday with an assistant. At this time he doesn't have any difficulties and he hopes to continue this way. Currently Carlos Alberto is 35 years old and separated from his wife. His children live with their mother, whom he helps financially.

With the loan he'll buy fruit wholesale for distribution. HIs dream is to expand his business to where he can offer a better service.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Prosperidad  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Prosperidad está formado por 12 socias y 1 socio, quienes se dedican al comercio y a la realización de varias actividades las que les permite mejorar su situación económica, se caracterizan por ser personas amables, gentiles y de un gran carisma y aun mantienen las costumbres de sus pueblos. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, la misma que esta bañada por 4 ríos, es desde Diciembre  de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad,  tiene varios y hermosos lugares para visitar, la gastronomía de esta ciudad es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Gabriela, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 15 y 14 años que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en un taller de carpintería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Gabriela se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y labora como secretaria en una compañía de radio taxi actividad que la desempeña hace 2 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo en horarios rotativos. Hace un año también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos  en sus tiempos libres.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para ampliar la variedad de su mercadería.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia. 

Las fotos pequeñas son de cuatro socias y un socio que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Prosperidad  communal bank is comprised of twelve women and one man.  They devote themselves to commerce and engage in various business activities, which allow them to improve their financial situations.  They are known for being kind, friendly, and very charismatic people who still maintain the customs of their villages.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. The city is surrounded by four rivers, and it was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999.   It has various beautiful places to visit.  The cuisine in this city is quite varied, and it captivates the palates of the locals and foreign visitors.

Gabriela, age 30, is one of the members of the group.  She is married, and they have two children, ages 15 and 14.  The children go to a school in the city.  Her husband works in a carpentry shop.  They do not have their own house, so they rent where they live.

Gabriela devotes herself to the household chores.  She also works as a secretary in a radio taxi company.  She has been doing this for two years.  She works from Sunday to Sunday on a rotating schedule.  For one year he has also been selling cosmetics in her free time.

Her communal bank is in its second cycle.  She will use the loan to buy cosmetics in order to expand her variety of merchandise.  Her dream is to have her own house.

The small photos are of four women and one man (members) who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Fenie

texts.en:
Fenie is 32 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Unidos, Plaridel. Fenie has a services business and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. 

Fenie is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase equipment for a sound system and bulbs used for services.  Fenie has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for a sound system and bulbs used for services

loans.name: Chimusana Group

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Nelson from Masvingo, a town in south-eastern Zimbabwe. He is married with three children, two attending school.  Nelson runs a retail business selling clothes and blankets. The business has been in operation for 8 years. He says the main challenges faced are competition in the market. 

Nelson has requested a loan of $300 to buy more clothes and blankets for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to be able to feed his family well. In the future Nelson is planning to own a shop and employ at least one person.

loans.use: To buy clothes and blankets for resale

loans.name: Budiriro Msvingo Group

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Fana from Masvingo. He is married with five children, all attending school.  Fana runs a retail business selling clothes, plates and shoes for resale. The business has been in operation for four years. He says the main challenges faced are price increases from wholesalers. 

Fana has requested a loan of $300 to buy clothes, plates and shoes for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to be able to feed his family well. In the future, Fana plans will be able to buy food for the family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, plates and shoes for resale

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es una joven emprendedora que hace poco inició su propio negocio en busca de mejores oportunidades económicas para brindar en su familia una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 padres. Fue así como montó una tienda general con unos ahorros que tenía y gracias a su dedicación ha venido creciendo mucho y generando cada vez más ventas. Debido a que su negocio lo montó con muy bajo capital, en un principio no contaba con mucha variedad de productos, sin embargo ha tenido la disciplina para ir creciendo poco a poco y así ir ofreciendo a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos. Andrea busca un préstamo para comprar un refrigerador y poder ofrecer a sus clientes carnes, pollo y demás productos que requieran de este almacenamiento.

De esta manera seguirá creciendo y cada vez generando más ingresos para que en su hogar mejore la calidad de vida y las oportunidades económicas. Su mayor sueño es sacar sus 2 padres adelante ofreciéndoles una buena calidad de vida y en un futuro crecer con su negocio y tener un supermercado.

loans.use: Comprar un refrigerador y poder ofrecer a sus clientes carnes, pollo y demás productos que requieran de este almacenamiento.

loans.name: Lilian Carmita

texts.es: Lilian tiene 58 años vive Suburbio zona sur urbana de Guayaquil. Tiene un taller de confecciones y bazar el cual inicio hace 22 años. Su trabajo diario empieza a las 9 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Lilian nos comenta que es muy  agradable su trabajo. Ella comenta que sus clientes frecuentes están muy asociados a ella ya que le gusta darles un buen trato. Gracias a su carisma y a sus amistades tiene exito en negocio. En la temporada de clases es cuando mas costuras tengo el por eso mi negocio crece mas. Espera conservar las fuerzas para continuar y ayudar a sus hijos en especial a su hija menor que está culminando sus estudios de secundaria. Lilian en su vida a tenido fortaleza en Dios y ayuda de su esposo  que trabajo de conserje y es pastor de una iglesia. Algunas dificultades para ella en su negocio es al comprar su mercadería lo hace con mucho receló al temor de la delincuencia. A pesar de las pruebas que Dios ha puesto en su vida a sabido continuar. Ella se siente realizada con su negocio quiere seguir trabajando. Nos dice que gracias a los créditos su casa su negocio han ido cambiando poco a poco...
texts.en: Lilian González Espinoza is 58 years old. She lives in El Suburbio, in the southern part of the urban area of Guayaquil. She has a tailoring workshop and stationery store, which she started 22 years ago. Her daily work begins at 9 in the morning until 10 at night. Lilian tells us that her work is very pleasant. She says that her frequent customers are very close with her, since she gives them good service. Thanks to her charisma and her friendships she is successful in her business. During the school year is when she has the most sewing, and this is why her business is growing more. She hopes to conserve her strength in order to continue and help her children, especially her youngest daughter, who is finishing her secondary school studies. In her life, Lilian has had strength in God and help from her husband, who works as a concierge and is the pastor of a church. A difficulty for her in her business is that when she buys her merchandise she does so very warily, afraid of delinquency. In spite of the tests that God has put in her life, she has known how to continue on. She feels fulfilled in her business. She wants to continue working and to continue with D-MIRO. She says that thanks to the loans, her house and her business have been changing bit by bit...

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: 3.14.155.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chút has a retail business selling dried food. She is requesting a loan to purchase eggs to resell.

Chút is 59 years old and she is married with 3 children. Chút is the group leader of the 3.14.155.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of 9 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Chút's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Chút has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Chút faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Chút hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, for her children to find good jobs, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: 3.14.156.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Nga is 42 years old and she is married with 3 children. Nga is the group leader of the 3.14.156.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Nga has been involved in this business for 7 years. The main harship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Nga hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en: Abenawa is a food vendor. She cooks banku for sale. She serves her banku with okro and fish stew. She has been cooking and selling banku for the last 5 years. She lives together with her husband at Abereshia near Elmina. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to assist her husband with paying their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish for preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to create a place for her customer to eat.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize for preparing her banku for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace fries doughnuts to sell at Abeshia near Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. Grace is a widow and has 3 children. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. Grace will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her doughnut business. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her doughnut business.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon is 56 years old.  She is widowed and resides with her brother and three nephews in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.  She has been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $3 per day. 

Yon is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to pay the expenses for her nephew’s wedding ceremony.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house in order to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to pay the expenses for her nephew's wedding ceremony.

loans.name: Vary

texts.en:
Vary is 42 years old. She is the mother of six children and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish and rice for more than two years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband runs a motor taxi service. He earns about $3 per day. One of her children is employed and earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Vary is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more rice to resell. By doing so, she will earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to resell

loans.name: Ngaet

texts.en: Ngaet is 41 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been selling dessert for more than three years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband sells coconut shakes. He earns about $7 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Ngaet is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 41-year-old hardworking lady with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children through college. She has been running a bar business for the last four years after using her own savings. She faces hardships like customers not paying on time; however, she has a vision of diversifying her business to include farming. Rose needs a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Djiguisseme 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe   Djiguisseme  6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kampogosso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec  HAWA ADAMA,  assise au milieu sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Djiguisseme 6 group are married women with an average age of 24, on average 3 children, and who all live in traditional family environments in Kampogosso, one of the villages in San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan with the institution. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

Hawa Adama, sitting in the middle of the picture, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy small agricultural equipment, agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the labourers needed to maintain 1 hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 165 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

Teneba, sitting on the far right of the picture, farms groundnuts. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 200 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Djigonso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali.

texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women with an average age of 39, on average 5 children, and who all live in traditional family settings in Djigonso, one of the villages in San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan with the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Koniba, sitting on the far right of the picture, farms corn. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay for the labourers needed to maintain 1.5 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 225 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Tukole Kakindo Group

texts.en:
Christine is a member of Tukole Kakindo group, where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan. She is hardworking and a married mother of six children. She owns a clothing business and she has been operating it for 5 years now.

She faces business challenges of high fuel costs and price fluctuations which she believes is cutting across and all her group members are facing the same challenges as well. Her family goal is to educate her children and build a permanent house, and her business goal is to expand to new markets. Christine needs the loan facility to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Bougoura, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali.

Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.

Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 205.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women with an average age of 48, on average 6 children, and who all live in traditional family settings in Bougoura, one of the villages in San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan with the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Assan, sitting second from the left in the picture, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay for the labourers needed to maintain 1.5 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 205 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Djigonso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs  avec  RAHAMA , 1ere assise de la droite  vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 185.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group BENKADI 2 are married women who average 41 years of age and five children each. They all live in traditional families in Djigonso, a village in San, the fourth administrative region of Mali. 

This is their third collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. All past loans were correctly repaid.

The group sells maize through Rahama, sitting first from the right in the photo. She will use her loan to purchase inputs, seeds and small farming tools, and to pay for the cost of plowing 1.25 hectares of land. After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village and at the market of San to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to earn an average profit of 185,000 CFAF per season. This will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase inputs, seeds and small farming tools, and to pay for the cost of plowing 1.25 hectares of land.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Bougoura, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz et l’arachide  avec  NANA,  1 ere  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles  et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 225.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Benkadi 3" are married women averaging 30 years of age and four children each all living in traditional families in Bougoura, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the wet season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crops grown are rice and peanuts, as is the case with NANA, the first one seated from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, seeds, and sundry farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 1.5 hectares.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women.

She expects to make an average profit of 225,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry equipment, and some seeds

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Djigonso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs  avec  MINATA, 1ere debout de la droite  vers la gauche  sur la photo.

Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec    SANATA ,   1 ere debout  en écharpe jaune sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Dababougou Benkadi 5" are married women averaging 31 years of age and four children each all living in traditional families in Soké, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with SANATA, the first one standing and wearing a yellow scarf in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, some seeds, and sundry farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining one hectare.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 150,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry equipment, and some seeds

loans.name: 3.14.158.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tình  works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Tình  is 46 years old and she is married with 3 children.  Tình  is the group leader of the 3.14.158.Thiệu Khánh  solidarity group, which consists of 9 members.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, her children have grown up.

This is Tình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  Tình  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Tình  faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tình hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and to hopes to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

La spéculation cultivée est : le riz  avec    MARAMOU ALOU,  1ere debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 0,75 hectare.

texts.en:
The members of the Gnarisso Benkadi 3 group are married women who average 39 years of age and 6 children each.  They all live in traditional families in Soké, one of the villages of the commune of San (fourth administrative region of Mali).

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to bring their farming activities to a successful conclusion during the rainy season.

This is their second loan with the institution.  Previous loans have been duly repaid.

Maramou Alou cultivates rice.  In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the right.

With her loan, Maramou Alou is planning to buy some light farming equipment, agricultural inputs and seeds.  She will also pay for the cost of plowing on 0.75 hectare of land.

Production will be sold after the harvest, at the village level and at the San market, to a customer base which consists of men and women.

Maramou Alou is expecting average profits to reach 110,000 CFA francs per season.  These profits will help her to repay her loan and to support her husband in taking care of the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of plowing, to buy inputs, light farming equipment and seeds.

Sali cultivates groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the right, and has a black shawl wrapped around her. 

With her loan, Sali is planning to buy some light farming equipment, agricultural inputs and seeds. She will also pay for the cost of plowing on 0.5 hectare of land.

Production will be sold after the harvest, at the village level and at the San market, to a customer base which consists of men and women.

Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

La spéculation cultivée est  Le riz  avec    KARIA  ,2 eme assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,75 hectare.

texts.en:
The members of the Gnarisso Benkadi 5 group are married women with an average age of 35, on average 5 children, and who all live in traditional family environments in Soké, one of the villages in San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 2nd loan with the institution. The previous loans have all been correctly repaid.

Karia, sitting second from the right in the picture, farms rice. She plans to use her loan to buy small agricultural equipment, agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the labourers needed to maintain three quarters of a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 100 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy agricultural inputs and small equipment, and seeds.

Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Gnarisso Benkadi group are 6 women living in traditional families in Soké, a village near San (4th largest administrative region of Mali). They are all married, and are on average 34 years old and have five children. The work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to continue their agriculture activities during the winter. This is the second loan they are asking for from the institution, all previous loans were successfully repaid. Djenebou, the woman sitting in the middle of the photo, focuses on growing and harvesting groundnuts. She plans to use this loan to purchase fertilizer, grains and other agriculture materials, as well as cover the labor costs associated with harvesting 0,75 acres of land. The produce will be sold in the village as well as in the market in San, to a customer base comprised of both men and women. She hopes to collect a profit of 100,000 FCFA (approximately 190 USD) which she will use to pay back her loan, as well as assist her husband in taking care of daily family needs.

loans.name: Hakilignouma 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   Hakilignouma 1des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kemeni, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec   FANTA  debout en Tshirt blanc sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Hakilignouma 1 group are married women averaging 42 years of age, with six children. They all live in traditional families in Kemeni, a village in the San Region, the fourth administrative district of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to successfully carry out their agricultural work during the winter system.
They are on their  second loan with the institution. The previous [loan] has been duly repaid. They cultivate rice, which is what  Fanta does, for example. On the photo, she is dressed in a white T-shirt, among those standing. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers] and seeds and to pay the cost of labor to work 1.5 ha [about 4 acres] of land. After harvesting, the produce will be sold in their village and at the market of San, to a customer base composed of resellers and consumers. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 195,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle. 
This income will allow her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband provide for everyday needs.

loans.use: to pay for labor, agricultural inputs and seeds.
