loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Dembagnouman sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans le quartier Pelengana de Ségou et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Château de Ségou. Les membres du groupe mènent des activités d’achat et de vente de pagnes wax, de condiments et de jus locaux. 
Dans le but de satisfaire les besoins de la clientèle de plus en plus croissants, elles ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 12ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Timi (1ère femme en position debout sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse de jus dans le quartier de Pelengana. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de sucre, 500 kg de tamarin et de gingembre. 
Pour faire des jus, elle imbibe  les fruits de gingembre et de tamarin dans l’eau pendant 3h au moins. le filtrat recueilli est ensuite aromatisé avec des essences puis on y ajoute du sucre. Le jus ainsi fait est mis dans les sachets et au frais avant la vente. 
Elle se ravitaille en matière première au grand marché de Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et en ambulant à Pelengana à une clientèle mixte. Madame Timi compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants, Madame Timi a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: Pour  acheter des ingrédients  pour la préparation des jus locaux

loans.name: Djantoyèrèla Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djantoyèrèla sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans le quartier Pelengana de Ségou et se sont connues à travers des relations de voisinage, de mariage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Pelengana. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de pagnes (wax et bazins), tubercules, condiments (tomate, échalote, choux pommés, . . .) et de jus locaux. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Rokiatou (1ère femme debout sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse de pagnes wax dans le quartier de Pelengana Ségou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché de Ségou.  La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile, au marché de Pelengana et en ambulant dans le quartier à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Rokiatou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et approvisionner le foyer en condiments; Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe, Madame Rokiatou a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: Pour  acheter des pagnes wax.

loans.name: Sop Sa Dieukeur 2 Group

texts.fr: Les femmes membres du groupe "SOPE SA DIEUKEUR 2" sont des commerçantes qui vendent des produits alimentaires.Elles s'approvisionnent tôt le matin au grand marché de la ville en légumes frais, en poisson et en divers condiments.Ces produits sont revendus aux femmes de leur quartiers sur des tables  installées devant leurs domiciles respectives.Ce commerce leur rapporte des revenus assez consistants qui leur permettent de s'occuper de leurs enfants et de prendre en charge leurs propres besoins.Afin de renforcer leurs fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 450 000f pour acheter des produits alimentaires.
texts.en: The [female] members of the "SOPE SA DIEUKEUR 2" group are vendors who sell food products.  They stock up early in the morning in the town's main market, buying fresh vegetables, fish and a range of seasonings.  The women then sell these products in their neighborhoods on tables that they set up in front of their own homes.  This work makes them a fairly solid income and it allows them to take care of their children and cover their own needs.  In order to strengthen their working capital, they are requesting a loan for 450,000 francs to buy food products.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia a 25-year-old woman from Irbid, Jordan, who lives with four other family members. She is requesting a loan of 300 JOD to pay for maintenance repairs on her home. Since Fadia is under 30, her loan is considered a youth loan. 

Due to cultural reasons Fadia prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Mahfouth

texts.en:
Mahfouth is a 46-year-old man who has three sons and a daughter. He doesn’t like his photo to be taken for personal reasons, so his son took his place in the photo. 

Mahfouth owns a shop for making and shaping aluminum. One of his sons, Obada, who is appearing in the photo, works with him in the shop.

Now Mahfouth has applied for this loan to buy new machines for the shops and do some maintenance on the ones he has.

loans.use: to buy new machines for the shops.

loans.name: Absolm

texts.en: Absolm is a 28-year-old married man living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been dealing in clothes for six years. He started with 2,000,000 shillings and now has 4,000,000 shillings as working capital. His hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goal is educating his children, while his business goal is owning a boutique. Absolm is borrowing money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a forty-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For the past five years he has selling timber. Customers not paying on time is a challenge for him however he has a dream of educating his children and owning one of the biggest timber store in town.
Samson needs the loan facility to buy trees for timber making.

loans.use: to trees for timber making.

loans.name: Isseu's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Association femme sengaz n°10" est composé de cinq femmes qui vendent toutes des produits cosmétiques.Elles achètent en gros dans la capitale ou dans les pays limitrophes pour amoindrir les charges.Elles vendent séparément leurs marchandises et parviennent à générer des revenus.Elles prennent ainsi en charge une bonne partie des dépenses d'alimentation de leurs familles ainsi que leurs propres besoins.Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 250000f pour acheter des produits de cosmétiques.
texts.en: The "Femme Sengaz no. 10" association is made up of five women who all sell cosmetic products. They buy their goods wholesale in the capital or in neighboring countries to reduce their expenses. They sell their goods separately and manage to generate income. They are thus able to take care of a large part of their families' food expenses as well as providing for their own needs. In order to strengthen their businesses, they are requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy cosmetic products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Agricultores La Capellania #5 Group

texts.es:
El señor Martin esta casado, tiene 48 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos 4 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura específicamente a la siembre de papas, m inicio este negocio con sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupos para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de insumos como semillas y fertilizantes, para cultivo de papas, ya que el en futuro quiere ver producto más grande, y transportar su producto. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de papas tipo ICTA FRIT.

loans.use: Comprar  insumos para siembra de papas

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 56 year old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan who has 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to buy children and women's clothes as well as accessories which she will be selling. This will expand her business by increasing the number of her products and increase her income. She hopes oneday to take a pilgrimage to Mecca in Saudi Arabia.

loans.use: to buy chidren and women's clothes for resale

loans.name: Enas

texts.en:
Enas is a single 19 year old woman from Al Hashimi, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy accessories, bags and clothes that she will be selling at the market. She hopes later to be able to open her own permanent shop to sell the products. She hopes to increase her social economic status. Since Enas is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan. 

*Enas prefers not to have her photo on the internet thus the above photo is of her brother

loans.use: to pay for accessories, bags and clothes that she will sell

loans.name: Enosi

texts.en:
Enosi, age 33, is a cattle trader. He lives with his wife and their two children in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Enosi has been engaged in his cattle-trading business for two years now. He faces the problem of inadequate capital with which to purchase cattle, and is also obstructed by inflation effects that lead to higher prices for cattle.

He has the personal goals of securing the education of his children and building a permanent home for the family. His business goal is to buy land to grow crops as well as to expand into new marketplaces.

Enosi is requesting a loan in order to buy cattle to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy cattle to offer for sale

loans.name: Aranas

texts.en: Arnas is a 19 year old woman from Sahab, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy clothes which she will sell. This will help to expand her current business. She would like to increase her income so that she can have a better standard of living. Since Arnas is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 29 year old married man from Sahab, Jordan who supports 3 family members. He is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to expand his shop selling fruits and vegetables. He would like to be able to sell a larger quantity and variety of products and thus increase his number of customers. This will help him increase his income and better support his family.

loans.use: to expand his fruit and vegetable shop

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 30 year old married woman from Hay Nazal Jordan who supports 4 family members. She is requesting a loan of 1500 JOD to buy materials for flower arranging that she will sell. She will also be buying clothes which she will be selling as well. She had a previous loan for her flower arranging business and would like to expand it. In the future she would like to buy a car. 

* Mariam prefers not to upload her photo on the internet thus the above photo is of her husband

loans.use: to pay for materials for flower arranging to sell, and clothes to sell

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 20 year old woman , from Sahab Jordan . She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to buy materials to make cheese and yogurt to sell. She wants increase her products and increase her capital . 
Since Majeda is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan .

loans.use: to pay for materials to make cheese and yogurt

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en: Wafa is a 45 year old maried woman , who has 4 family members, from Ashrafia Amman Jordan . She is requesting a loan to buy home products especially for the kitchen (such as dishes, cups etc.) to sell . She would like expand her existing project and also increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for home products to sell

loans.name: Suad

texts.en: Suad is a 22 year old woman from Jubeiha, Amman Jordan who supports one family member and owns a beauty salon. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to repaint the inside of her salon and decorate it. In the future she hopes that her family will take a part in developing her salon. Since Suad is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to her beauty salon

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 50 years-old.  She is a widow and has five children aged between 20 and 38 years.

She has been selling food for 17 years and she has a monthly income of fifty thousand Kenyan shillings.  The loan will be used to purchase stock skuma wiki, cabbages.The anticipated profits will be used to purchase land in order to construct her own house.

This is her loan from Kadet.  Her dreams and hopes are to start another business.

loans.use: to buy more assorted vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 31 year old married woman from Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan who has 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to do home improvements. She would like to build an extra floor to her home. She always is striving to improve her socio-economic conditions for her family.

 * Hanan prefers not to display her photo on the internet, thus the above photo is of her mother.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 41 year old maried woman ,who has supports 3 family members. From Baqa'a Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD for her home improvments . She wants to buy new furniture and home appliances.
She would like to improve the social economic status of her family. 
In the future she hopes to have a home for her family .
Mariam prefers not to display her photo in the internet, thus the above photo is of her brother .

loans.use: to pay for her home  improvments

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 44 year old maried man, who has 5 family members. From Al Russeifeh Jordan . He is requesting a loan of 1500 JOD for his restaurant improvments. He has a machine for Hummus and Falafel and he wants to buy another machine to make Foul (a type of bean dish) . In the future he hopes open another branch for his restaurant.

loans.use: to pay for his restaurant improvements

loans.name: Shefa'a

texts.en:
Shefa'a is a 20 year old woman .from Al Karak Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for accessories to expand her shop. In the future she would like to increase her income. 

Shefa'a prefers not to display her photo on the internet, thus the above photo is of her uncle.

loans.use: to pay for accessories to expand her shop

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa sells maize at Eguafo near Elmina. She is divorced and has seven dependents. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay her children’s school fees. 

Theresa needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for resale. With the new profit, Theresa wishes to acquire a large quantity of maize to distribute to the retailers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 45 old year married woman, who has 4 family members. From Al Zarqa, Amman Jordan.She requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for food materials to sell ( Traditional food : Dawali, Mahashi.....)
She would like open a shop. In the future she wants to increase her income also economic and financial development .

loans.use: to pay for food materials to sell

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam is a 44 year old married woman. who has 3 family members.From Ashrafia, Amman Jordan. She requesting is a loan of 500 to pay for clothes and blankets to sell. She wants to expand her project.
In the future she would like to increase income for her familly .

loans.use: to pay for clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Makboleh

texts.en:
Makboleh is a 28 year old married woman . Who has 2 family members. From Al Russeifeh Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 to pay for home improvements and to buy new furniture.

Since Makboleh is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan .

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Infisal

texts.en:
Infisal is a 38 year old woman from Al Karak, Jordan who lives with 3 other family members. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to do home improvements especially in the kitchen. She would like to install new kitchen cabinets. 

Infisal prefers not to have her photos on the internet thus the above photo is of her husband

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 49 year old woman from Baqa'a Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for materials for flower arranging to sell. She would like to expand her project so that she can better supporting her mother.
In the future she wants to increase her social economic status.

Amal prefers not to put her photo on the internet, thus the above photo is of her brother

loans.use: to pay for materials for flower arranging to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi extracts palm oil and palm kernel oil to sell at Asafora near Cape Coast.  She is married.  Esi uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodation bills. Esi will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit and palm kernel to extract oil to sell. With the new profit she wishes to buy a machine for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit and palm kernel to extract oil to sell.

loans.name: Diamante Group

texts.es:
Diamante es un grupo de mujeres comprometidas con ellas mismas y con sus familias que las impulsan para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Maria Isela, es integrante del grupo, esposa y madre de tres hijos. Ella es entusiasta y se ha esmerado en incrementar y su economía familiar y es por ello que decidió establecer una estética en su domicilio.
Ella solicita este crédito para seguir creciendo y acondicionando su negocio, con mejores productos y mercancía, así como prepararse mediante cursos que le ayuden a atraer cada día a más clientes.
Esta convencida que este compromiso que contrae con nosotros ahora, le permitirá crecer como empresaria.
texts.en:
The Diamante group is made up of  women committed to themselves, and their families who compel them to improve their quality of life.  
Maria Isela, a member of the group, is married with three children.  She is enthusiastic and has taken great pains to increase her family income and for this reason, she decided to establish a beauty salon in her home. 
 
She is requesting the loan to continue growing and supplying her business with better products and merchandise.  She is also preparing herself through beauty technician courses, which will help her attract more customers each day.  She is convinced that contracting in this agreement with us now will allow her to grow as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for her beauty salon and pay for beauty technician courses.

loans.name: Nazaret Triunfadoras 1 Group

texts.es:
La señora Lidia Estela está casada, tiene 32 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales, están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este negocio con poco capital y tejiendo solo un corte y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de varios colores y así mejorar su producción de cortes típicos, espera en el futuro tener más telares y mas trabajares. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la tejeduría también.

loans.use: Comprar insumos para tejidos

loans.name: Duo Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
DUO BUENA VISTA
La señora Beatriz Elizabeth está en la necesidad de pedir un nuevo capital ya que ve que sus ventas han crecido, la venta  principal de ella es productos comestibles (frijol,arroz,aceite,jabon,etc)esta venta  quiere de mucho capital y no le alcanza lo que tiene, por eso ella hace una nueva solicitud y así poder comprar lo que el cliente le pide y no perder la oportunidad de superarse a través de sus ventas. aparte de eso como venta secundaria se dedica a La venta de tamales es muy buena para ella ya que cocina muy delicioso y tiene pedidos siempre de tamales. La carne de marrano que es la que ella mas utiliza le subieron de precio y necesita comprar más carne para poder entregar sus pedidos a sus clientes.ella a tenidos otros credito y los a cancelado con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Duo Buena Visa

Beatriz Elizabeth needs to request a new loan because she sees that her sales have grown.  Her primary sales come from grocery products such as beans, rice, oil, soap, etc.  This products require a lot of capital, and she does not have enough.  That is why she is making a new request.  This way she will be able to buy what the customer asks for, and she will not lose the opportunity to succeed via her sales. 

In addition to the products above she also sells tamales.  Tamale sales are very good for her because the way she cooks them is very delicious.  She always has tamale orders.  The pork that she uses the most has gone up in price.  She needs to buy more meat in order to be able to deliver the orders to her customers.

She has had loans in the past and has always paid them off responsibly.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as beans, rice, oil, soap, etc. as well as to buy ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Paquecaquisis Group

texts.es:
El señor Lucas está soltero, tiene 21 años de edad, curso 2 años de educación primaria, se dedica al comercio de ropa de toda clase para todas las edades, inicio este negocio con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia y le ha resultado este negocio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un  préstamo que lo utilizara para a compra de mercadería y poder así tener más variedad de producto que ofrecer, espera en el futuro tener un capital más amplio y un negocio bien posicionado  en el mercado. Los demás integrantes se dedica al comercio. Una de las que estan en la foto no califico para el credito.

loans.use: Comprar mercadería

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
La señora Elena está casada, tiene 36 años de edad, cursó solamente un año en la escuela primaria, tiene 1 hijos el cual esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio de ropa típica, inicio este negocio con la expectativa de tener un trabajo y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de ropa para señorita y poder así mejorar, su negocio y sus ventas, espera tener más capital y un local propio para su venta. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a comercio, venta de ropa, tortillas, refacciones y una de ella se dedica a la elaboración de dulces al horno.

loans.use: Comprar mercadería

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.en:
Ugiloy is the perfect business lady. She knows all aspects of business very well. Her experiences always help to her to be the best among her competitors. 

She has two businesses, with which she helps her children and her husband. The first and main is selling food products. The second is keeping livestock, which she has done for 30 years.

Ugiloy wants to develop her business, and that’s why she is asking a loan for buying livestock. She is awaiting your help.

loans.use: To buy livestock.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Richard. He is single and has no children but he has a dependent who lives with him and serves as a sales assistant.  

In 2010, Richard established his leather slippers business. He began his business because he learned it through apprenticeship, and that is his source of livelihood. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 750,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Richard requires a loan in order to buy 100 leather slippers @ SLL 40,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 4,000,000. 

In the future, Richard plans to increase his stock level, marry a productive wife and to build a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 100 leather slippers @ Le 40,000

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a married man. He has a child who is  years old. He describes himself as a dedicated and intelligent man. He operates a retail stall where he sells items such as biscuits, sweets, water, sodas, etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located near a bus station and his primary customers are passengers. He describes his biggest business challenge as the high prices of items. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more confections for resale. His business goal is to run a retail shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children with the profits generated.

loans.use: to buy more confections for his business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a single man. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a motorcycle whereby he provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a competitive business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to buy two more motorcycles within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Quebradilla Iii Group

texts.es:
El señor Damian está casado, tiene 49 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 9 hijos 1 de los cuales estudia, se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de papa y habas, inicio este trabajo con sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 25 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de insumos para la siembra de papas y habas, semillas y fertilizante, espera en el futuro tener mas extensión de terreno y transporte para llevar su cosecha. Los demás integrantes se dedican al mismo trabajo. El capital es pagado al vencimiento.

loans.use: Comprar insumos para siembra de papas y habas

loans.name: San Miguel Chuanoj Group

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria es casada, tiene 45 años de edad, estudio sus estudios de primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició este trabajo como operaria y hasta ahora lleva 4 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la tejeduría también.

Decide organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de hilos de diferentes cuales y colores para el tejido de cortes típicos de diferentes de diferentes estilos y colores, espera en el futuro ver su negocio con operarios. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, tejeduría de cortes típicos, tejido de sabanas y a la talabartería.

loans.use: purchase thread for weaving.

loans.name: Las Cinco Rosas Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Eufemia está casada, tiene 36 años de edad, cursó 3 años la educación primaria, tiene 6 hijos 5 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este trabajo como empleada y hasta el momento lleca 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para compra hilos de varios colores y así poder tener mas producción de tejidos, espera en el futuro tener más capital de trabajo. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la tejeduría, atención a tienda, y crianza de animales.

loans.use: Comprar hilo

loans.name: Cristo Nos Ama Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Cristo nos Ama esta conformado por 10 integrantes, Ramona, Candida, Ramona, Dominga, Ramon, Migdalia, Jaqueline, Cleto, Perla, Guadalupe, todas tiene por actividad economica la elaboracion y venta de artesania ya que es la actividad fuerte de su actividad, el financiamiento lo quieren para comprar, Ollas de barro, pinturas, pincel, arcillas. Entre otros.
texts.en: The Cristo Nos Ama Communal Bank is made up of ten members, Ramona, Candida, Ramona, Dominga, Ramon, Migdalia, Jaqueline, Cleto, Perla, and Guadalupe.  They all make and sell craftwork for a living as it is their strong suit.  They want this loan to buy clay pots, paints, paintbrushes, and clay, among other things.

loans.use: to buy clay pots, paints, paintbrushes, and clay, among other things

loans.name: Flor Del Durazno Group

texts.es:
El señor Mario está casado, tiene 39 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y café, inicio este trabajo con sus padres hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de fertilizante, para poder mejorar su producción de maíz y café, ya que en el futuro quiere tener más extensión de terreno para sembrar mas café y mas maíz. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al mismo trabajo. el capital es pagado al vencimiento.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizante para siembra de maiz y cafe

loans.name: Asociacion Barbarense Group

texts.es:
El señor Felix está casado, tiene 57 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad, de estudiar, tiene 8 hijos 3 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la agricultura específicamente a la siembra de maíz y frijol, inicio este trabajo con sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 40 años de experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo de su esposa quien hace el mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de fertilizante para tener una mejor cosecha de maíz y frijol,  y tener todo su terreno sembrado. Los demas integrantes del grupo se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio. el capital es cancelado al vencimiento.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizante para cultivar maiz y frijol

loans.name: Arkam

texts.en:
Akram is a 43-year-old carpenter from Al Russeifeh, Jordan who supports 5 family members.

He is requesting a loan of 2,000 JOD to buy a new machine for cutting timber as well as extra timber. In doing so, he wants to develop and expand his current business to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to pay for timber and a new wood cutting machine

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 45-year-old married woman who has 6 family members. From Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to pay for her home improvements, and she wants to buy new furniture for the guest room and living room. In the future she would like to do another project to increase her family's income. 

Zainab prefers not to display her photo on the internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 50 year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan who has four family members. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD in order to pay for her son's university tuition. Her aspirations are to buy a car and own a home. She always strives to improve her family's socio-economic status. The photo above is of Aida's son.

loans.use: to pay for university education.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is the woman preparing soup. She operates a chop bar (where variety of African dishes are sold). She has done this for 2 years. The foods she serves are fufu, banku, meat soup, fish soup, and rice balls. She is married and has  4 children. Aba uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare food for sale. With the new profit, Aba plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is a 27-year-old married man. He is from Al Zarqa, Amman Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for his home improvements. In the future he wants to expand his home and increase the social economic status of his family. 
Since Ramadan is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements.

loans.name: Ayesh

texts.en: Ayesh is a 30-year-old married woman who supports 1 family member. She is from Al Aqaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to pay for household products to sell. In the future, she would like to open a shop to sell her products in general.

loans.use: to pay for household products to sell.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 32-year-old married woman who has three family members. She is from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She will be repainting her home and she also wants to buy new furniture. In the future, she would like to expand her home. 

Sahar prefers not to display her photo on the Internet. Thus, the above photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 33-year-old married woman from A Karak Jordan who supports three family members .She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements and she would like to buy new furniture.

Rima prefers not to display her photo on the internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba cultivates maize for sale at Amoanda, near Cape Coast. She has done so for 3 years now. Aba is married with 5 children. She uses her income to help her husband feed and pay their children’s school fees. Aba will use her loan to cultivate more maize to sell.  With the new profit, Aba will expand her business.

loans.use: To cultivate maize for sale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a petty trader, she trades in ladies and children's dress, underwear, jeans and shoes. She has done so for 3 years now. Esi is married to a shoe maker and has 5 children. They live at Ewusi, near Cape Coast. She helps her husband pay for their children's expenses. Esi will use her loan to purchase more ladies and children dresses, and underwear to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Esi wishes to acquire a shop to sell her goods.

loans.use: To purchase ladies and childrens dresses and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Seham

texts.en:
Seham is a 39-year-old married woman who has four family members. She is from Al Karak, Jordan.

She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for various products such as perfumes, makeup, and clothes to sell. In the future, she would like to increase her products through opening a shop.

Seham prefers not to display her photo on the Internet. Thus, the above photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for various products such as perfumes, makeup, and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a 53-year-old married woman from Hay Nazal, Jordan, who supports three family members. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to pay for clothes to sell.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 60-year-old businessman. He is married to Elizabeth who is a business lady. They are blessed with six children. He has been in a Shylock business for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 16,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Gabriel will use the loan to get enough money for his clients. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to start a micro finance business and improve the family living standard.

loans.use: to get enough money for his clients.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha has a grocery store business in Nakuru town which she has operated for the last three years.  She is 33 years old, married to Francis, and they have five children.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of vegetables and potatoes to sell in her business.  With the anticipated profits she plans to add more variety of grocery items like fruits and cereals.

In the future, Martha hopes to grow her business and open a big grocery and cereal store and be able to provide all the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: buy vegetables and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is married with 4 children. He is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. Marlon owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. He has been doing this for 21 years and every month he earns 35,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand his product offering. He has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Marlon hopes to save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand his product offering

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 5 children. For the past 20 years, Elizabeth has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar and salt. 

To help expand her business, Elizabeth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, like cooking oil,mize flour and sugar for resale, and it will help Elizabeth to generate greater profits. Elizabeth hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a whole sale  shop further. 

Elizabeth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Elizabeth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, like cooking oil,mize flour and sugar for resale,

loans.name: Fayzeh

texts.en: Fayzeh is a 35-year-old married woman from Al-Bayader, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to pay for household products and blankets to sell. In the future, she would like to open a shop. She also hopes to buy a home.

loans.use: to pay for household products and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Diarra's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été créé le 05 mai 2012  est composé de 32 femmes issues du meme village. Elles ont pour activité principale l'agriculture.

Madame Aissatou à l’extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras est la responsable du groupe.Elle est âgée de 48 ans.Elle a pour activité principale le commerce de denrées alimentaires.Elle est mariée et mére de 08 enfants dont 02 garçons. 

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en oignons:150kg,en poissons séchés:200kg et en riz:200 kg ,ainsi elle pourra faire face à la demande de sa clientéle.

Son objectif est d'accroitre son épargne,d'assurer la santé de ses enfants et participer à l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" Koukou was founded on 5 May 2012. The group consists of 32 women from the same village. Their main business activity is agriculture.

Madame Aissatou is the leader of the group. She is standing on the far right of the photo with her arm raised. She is 48 years old. Her main business activity is trading general foodstuffs. She is married and is mother to 8 children including 2 boys.

This loan will enable her to buy: 150 kg of onion, 200 kg of dried fish and 200 kg of rice so that she will be able to satisfy the demand of her customers.

Her goal is to increase her savings, ensure the health of her children and take care of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy onions, dried fish and rice

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 16  mujeres de la ciudad de Encarnación. El comité ya tiene un poco de experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que hace meses que trabajan juntas y se han ayudado en estos ciclos.
Una de las integrantes, Porfiria, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo. Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropa, se  integro al comité de su barrio para que con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya pueda iniciar alguna actividad para ayudar a mejorar sus ingresos y así por medio de su trabajo sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que ella se encuentra sola.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de jeans, camperas, buzos, remeras, pantalones y demás prendas, con las cuales podrá estar bien surtida para ofrecer una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee consists of 16 women from the city of Encarnación. They have a little bit of experience working together as a group. The members have been together for a few months and will help one another in their upcoming loan cycles.

One of the members is Porfiria, who is a single mother with one child. She says that she sells clothing and joined her neighborhood committee so that she could obtain the supported offered by Fundación Paraguaya. Porfiria started her business so that she could improve her income and help her son get ahead since she is raising him alone. She is requesting a loan in order to buy jeans, jackets, sweatshirts, T-shirts, trousers, and other garments. This will help her remain well-stocked so that she can offer a wide variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy jeans, jackets, sweatshirts, T-shirts, trousers, and other garments.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a 49-year-old married woman from Hay Nazal, Jordan, who lives with her four family members. Basma prefers not to display her photo on the internet and this photo is of her son.

Basma is requesting a 1,000 JOD loan to buy a modern digital camera. In the future, she plans on opening a photo shop and her dream is to buy her family their own home.

loans.use: to pay for beauty salon supplies

loans.name: Samia

texts.en: Samia is a 44-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan who has four dependents. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to repaint her home and expand it. She hopes that in the future she will own a home that her family can live in.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Ines Nicolas

texts.es: Nicolás tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos, su esposa se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cerdos, es una familia muy unida y trabajadora, ellos residen en la comunidad de La Paz, Trojes, El paraíso. El se dedica al cultivo del café quien aprendió el oficio desde que era un niño ya que trabajaba en conjunto con su padre, el inicio a cultivar su propia finca en el cual el trabajo lo realiza a diario y con sus empleados, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 1:00 pm. La ventaja de Nicolás es que su propiedad se encuentra en una zona muy apta para el cultivo y por lo tanto la producción del Café se da muy bien, por lo que Nicolás solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abono, chapear la tierra y pago de mano de obra, y así darle un mejor y adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo. Su meta es poco a poco ir tecnificando su finca para que su cosecha sea mas productiva para que esta le genere mayores ganancias y así poder sacar adelante a su familia. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y piensa invertir muy bien el dinero para luego pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en: Nicolás is 48 years old, he is married and he has 4 children. His wife breeds chickens and pigs. Theirs is a very close-knit and hardworking family, and they live in the La Paz community, Torjes, El Paraíso. He engages in growing coffee, an activity he has learned when he was a child working with his father. He has then started his own farm, where he daily works together with his laborers. He works form 6 am to 1 pm. The area where Nicolás’ property is located is particularly suitable for his crops, and this is an advantage for him, and his coffee production goes very well; for this reason, Nicolás is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of manure, to clean his land from weeds and to pay his laborers, in order to provide better and appropriate maintenance to his crops. He aims at progressively making his farm more technical to improve the productiveness of his crops and to consequently increase his earnings in order to provide for his family. This is his first cycle with FAMA and he plans on investing the money well to then be punctual in the repayment of his dues.

loans.use: To buy manure and to pay for laborers.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a forty-six year old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal to educate his children to attain a degree as a minimum qualification. 

Christopher has been a farmer for the last twelve years and is facing hardships due to seasonal weather and soil exhaustion. Christopher needs a loan to buy fertilizers for his plantations.

His vision is to buy land to grow more crops and engage in modern farming activities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his plantations.

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es: La señora Zulema tiene 32 años de edad es de una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos. Cultiva superficies muy pequeñas por no disponer de recursos económicos. Vive en la comunidad de Villa Moderna del municipio de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba. La señora Zulema trabaja en el sector agropecuario desde muy pequeña y produce cebolla, papa y frijol para la alimentación de sus hijos y el excedente lo comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive con los comerciantes de la población de Mizque. Zulema es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser la responsable de la alimentación y la educación de sus hijos. Ella está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más semilla, abonos y agroquímicos para mejorar la calidad y cantidad de su producción y de esta manera tener más ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Zulema is 32 years old. She is from a modest family of scarce resources. She cultivates very small areas because of not having economic resources at her disposal. She lives in the community of Villa Moderna in the town of Mizqyue in Cochabamba Department.

Sra. Zulema has been working in the agricultural sector since she was very young. She produces onions, potatoes and beans to feed her children and sells the surplus from the same place where she lives to merchants in Mizque. She is a person who is highly respected in her community because of her dedication to her work and because she is so responsible about feeding and educating her children.

She is applying for the current loan to purchase more seeds, fertilizers and agrochemicals to improve the quality and quantity of her production so that she will have more income and improve the living conditions of all of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Norris

texts.en:
Norris is a recurrent borrower with us from Kyotera town council. She runs a boutique that sells ladies' clothes and accessories. She started the business so that she could earn income to take care of her four children and her day to day family expenses. Norris is taking a loan of 3,000,000 shillings to restock her business.

Her challenges are the high cost of rent and limited capital. With the boost from the loan, she hopes to make some profit and buy a piece of land. Norris is very hard working.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La señora Dionicia tiene 59 años está casada con el señor Gerónimo juntos tienen  3 hijos que aun dependen de sus ingresos y además están estudiando en la universidad, una de sus hijas estudia en el colegio militar, a pesar de su edad  juntos trabajan muy duro para casar adelante a sus hijos, viven en la comunidad de Playa Ancha de la ciudad de Cochabamba, viven en su casa propia su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, la leche entregan a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos y también se dedican a la producción de semillas de  Cebolla y Zanahoria en sus terrenos agrícolas que tiene.
El destino del crédito es la para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero con lo cual incrementara su producción y tendrá más ingresos mismo que lo usara para los estudios de sus hijos.
Entre sus sueños de doña Dionicia es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y que de esa  manera puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida y además  ya no trabajaran tanto y descansaran ya que están en la edad de hacerlo.
texts.en:
Sra. Dionicia is 59 years old and married to Sr. Gerónimo.  They have three children who are financially dependent on them and are also studying at the university.  One of their daughters attends a military college.  Despite their age, Dionicia and her husband work very hard as a couple so that their children can move forward.  They live in the community of Playa Ancha in the city of Cochabamba.  Dioncia and her husband own their home and her main business activity is raw milk production.  The milk is delivered to a company that makes dairy products.  Dionicia also plants onion and carrot seeds on the farmland that she owns.  

This loan will be used to buy one head of dairy cattle so that she can increase production.  She will have more income to designate for her children’s studies.  Doña Dionicia dreams of seeing her children finish their education so that they can have a better standard of living.  At that point, she and her husband can stop working and rest since they are already at the appropriate age to do so.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y tiene 6 hijos, es una persona muy trabajadora con mucho espíritu de trabajo, la esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.  Rene hace algún tiempo que se dedica al cultivo de sandia y maíz, aprendió del oficio el solo, siempre noto que el negocio era muy rentable por lo que decidió iniciar con su propia cosecha para cultivar maíz y sandia, lo hace desde hace 6 años, trabaja diariamente desde las  5:00 am a 2:00 pm. Una de sus desventajas es que tiene que fertilizar la cosecha por la plaga que le puede dañar la producción y también afecta la escases de agua para la cosecha. El préstamo que Rene esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de semilla para sembrar más maíz, sandia y para el pago de mano de obra, con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá tener una mejor producción ya que su cosecha estará en mejores condiciones. Su meta es tener una buena cosecha que sea de calidad y muy productiva. Es su tercer préstamo que solicita en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Rene, age 49, is married and has six children.  He is a very hard-working person with a great work ethic.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores.  

Rene has been growing watermelons and corn for some time.  He learned this trade by himself.  He always noticed that the business was very profitable.  Therefore, he decided to start his own yield by growing corn and watermelons.  He has been doing this for six years.  He works every day from 5:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m.

One of his disadvantages is that he has to treat the crops for the pests that can damage the production.  Also, the scarceness of water affects the crops.

Rene needs the loan he is requesting to buy seeds to plant more corn and watermelon.  He also needs the loan to pay for the labor.  With the support from this loan he will be able to have better production because his harvest will be in better condition.

His goal is to have a good harvest that is of good quality and very productive.  

This is the third loan he has requested from FAMA.  He has made his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy watermelon and corn seeds and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Carlos Adalid

texts.es: Carlos tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. El comenzó a trabajar con su papa desde hace 20 años, se dedica al cultivo de sandia y maíz, el horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 3:00 pm. La ventaja es que cuando el tiempo climático es favorable la cosecha le resulta muy productiva y la desventaja es la venta de su producto que el precio suele ser bajo. El préstamo que Carlos esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de semilla de sandia y pago de mano de obra de sus empleados. Con la ayuda de este préstamo tendrá mayores facilidades para sembrar ya que tendrá el capital necesario para invertirlo en la siembra. Los problemas que enfrenta a la hora de la cosecha son las diferentes plagas e insectos que dañan la producción. Su meta es tener una cosecha muy productiva que le pueda dejar ganancias para ayudar al sustento de su familia. Es su primer préstamo solicitado en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Carlos is 40 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He is a very hard-working and responsible person. His wife devotes herself to household tasks. He started to work with his father 20 years ago. He grows watermelon and corn, and his work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. The advantage is that when the weather is favorable the harvest is very productive. The disadvantage is selling his product, since the price tends to be low. Carlos needs the loan he is requesting to purchase watermelon seeds and to pay for his employees' labor. With the help of this loan, it will be easier for him to plant, since he will have the necessary capital to invest in the planting. The problems he faces at harvest time are the different infestations and insects that damage the crops. His goal is to have a very productive harvest that can give him income to help sustain his family. This is his first loan requested through FAMA and he hopes to be punctual with his payments.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon seeds and to pay for labor

texts.en: Kefaya is a 39 year old married woman who supports 6 family members from Al-Russeifeh Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to pay for her home improvements, she wants to repaint her home and to buy a new furniture. In the past she was buying clothes, blankets and housewares to sell. Now she would like to benefit from another loan to provide for her family a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Ustawi Group

texts.en:
Asteria is in her early 30s and is married with four children, three of whom go to school while one is still small. She has been a tailor since 1994. She also sells second-hand shoes and fabrics. She works from 6 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 
This will be her her eleventh loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start selling second-hand shoes and fabrics, buy a TV set and a radio, pay school fees and meet household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is requesting this loan to buy more second-hand shoes for resale. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.
Asteria will share this loan with her loan group "Ustawi", which has a total of 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand shoes for resale.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 43 year old married woman who has 3 family members from Marka Amman Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for materials for flower arranging to sell, she wants to expand her project.In the future she would like to increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for materials for flower arranging to sell

loans.name: Monira

texts.en:
Monira is a 37 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Sahab Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 499 JD to pay for various products to sell such as clothes, blankets and housewares.In the future she would like to re-do a room in her home specifically for selling her products and she hopes to increase her income.
Monira is a conservative woman,she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her husband

loans.use: to pay for various products to sell

loans.name: Nada'a

texts.en: Nada'a is a 42 year old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan who helps support 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy materials for making traditional food dishes. She plans on opening a shop selling these foods. She would like to help improve her family's economic situation in this way.

loans.use: to buy materials for making traditional foods

loans.name: Abeer

Abeer is a conservative woman,she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her husband

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 45 year old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan who helps support 5 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy fabric for making traditional Arabic seating cushions. She would like to expand her current project so that she can open a shop to sell the projects. She also has future aspirations to open an electronics shop. Siham hopes that this will help improve her family's economic conditions.

loans.use: to pay for fabric to make traditional Arabic seating cushions

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is a 20 year old married woman who supports 1 family member from AL Nasser Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for materials for making sweets she wants to increase her income.In the future she would like to expand her project through opening a shop and she hopes to buy a home.
Since Haya is under 30 year old,her loan is considered a youth loan

loans.use: to pay for materials for making sweets

loans.name: Nafeen

texts.en: Nafeen is a 33 year old married woman from Sahab, Jordan who has 5 dependents. She is requesting a loan of 700 JOD to help pay for home improvments. She will be buying new furniture and repainting her house. She would like to make these improvements for her family.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Twitange Group

texts.en:
Benjamin, who is in his early sixties, is married with ten children, two of whom go to school. He has seven grandchildren who go to school. Benjamin has been running two businesses for the past two years, selling fruits and vegetables and selling sacks of charcoal. He works from 6:00 am to 8:30 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Benjamin's fifteenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to buy more sacks of charcoal and fruits and vegetables, and to pay for household expenses and school fees. He has repaid all of his loans successfully. Benjamin wants a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and to increase his stock of fruits and vegetables.

Benjamin will share this loan with his loan group "Twitange" that has a total of sixteen members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and increase his stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Wrood

texts.en:
Wrood is a 22 year old single woman from Al Russeifeh Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 700 JD to pay for materials for embroidery to sell such as silk, beads and fabric, she would like to open a project. In the future she wants to increase her income.
Since Haya is under 30 year old,her loan is considered a youth loan

loans.use: to pay for materials for embroidery to sell

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 26 year old married woman who has 2 family members from Al Russeifeh Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to pay for housewares to sell to her friends and neighbors,she wants to help her husband.In the future she would like to open a shop.
Since Amani is under 30 year old,her loan is considered a youth loan

loans.use: to pay for housewares to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Benkadi 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Sirakele, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec Moyama, 1 ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo avec son enfant.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to grow her business. She has also expanded her business because she has been trained on business management skills. She hopes to operate another company in a different location in the future. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to repair her vehicles.

loans.use: to repair her vehicles.

texts.fr:

Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 2eme  prêt avec l’institution, le prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec Alima, présidente du groupe debout au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 0,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de Bla et Dougouwolo, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75.000 FCFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Frais de labour,  achat d’intrants et de semence

loans.name: Amera

She plans on opening a store from one of the rooms in her home. She would like to increase her income in this way. Faten prefers that her photo is not on the internet, the photo is of her daughter.

loans.name: Kansé

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Kansé a plus de 32 ans, marié et père de deux enfants, il réside avec sa famille à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Kansé  après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié au domaine du commerce d’articles divers. Actuellement Kansé  dispose d’une  boutique de Prêt à Porter et d’une Alimentation à la gare routière de Sikasso. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y environ quatre année et  il est à son cinquième prêt individuel.
Ce nouveau prêt il compte acheter, 30 chemises différentes, 20 pantalons de qualité différentes, 25 paires de chaussure différentes (Soulier, Ferardine, etc.), 8 complets de veste, 10 Tee-Shirt et 5 complets de sous-vêtement. Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes à Bamako avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement des voyageurs et surtout des routiers.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 350 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.

loans.use: Pour acheter d’habillement

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Agée de 47 ans, Awa est veuve et mère de 2 enfants résidant avec ses enfants dans la maison de son défunt époux à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Awa n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, s’est initiée depuis plus de dix ans à cette activité d’achat et de vente des poissons frais et l’oignons en provenance de Dakar (République du Sénégal). 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ quatre  ans. Elle est actuellement à son neuvième prêt  individuel  et les huit prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ce neuvième prêt lui permettra d’acheter 50 cartons de poissons frais et 25 sacs d’Oignons avant de les revendre en détail et en gros aux commerçantes de Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Pour acheter des poissons frais et oignons

Ferial is a conservative woman,she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her brother's.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Agée de 31 ans, Madame Mariam est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire à Médine Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de deux ans à cette activité de vente d’oignons au nouveau  marché de Médine dont elle dispose une  table où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux années. Elle est à son cinquième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 30 sacs d’oignons de graines différentes (15 sacs de petites graines et 15 sacs de grosses graines).
Ses marchandises sont vendues au comptant à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménage.
Avec ce prêt  elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.name: Abeteraine Bughoye Group

texts.en:
Ferediano is a 48-year-old married woman with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for eight years. She started by selling one bag per month and now she sells nine bags of cassava flour in a month. 

Her hardships are seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase enough stock. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house for residence, while her business goals are expanding the business into new markets and moving it to a more permanent location. Ferediano wants money to buy cassava flour to sell. She is a member of the above-mentioned group, in which each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.
